subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Can All Religions Be True?
description: A fast breakdown of Can All Religions Be True? for builders.

hook.text: If Christianity is true, Islam can't be. If Buddhism is true, a creator God is unnecessary. Can they all be right?

buildup.text: Exclusivists say only one religion is true. Pluralists say all paths lead to the same summit.

discovery.text: The parable of the blind men and the elephant is used by pluralists: each grasps part of a larger truth.

twist.text: But religions make contradictory claims. Saying all are true can erase what makes each one distinct and meaningful.

climax.text: The question may be wrong. Perhaps religions aren't true or false but useful â€” different tools for different needs.

quiz.question: What does religious pluralism claim?
options: Multiple paths can lead to the same truth
